clues.text: 2016: Barry Jenkins, from Tarell McCraney's play
2002: Ronald Harwood, from the memoir by Polish musician Wladyslaw Szpilman
2005: Larry McMurtry & Diana Ossana, based on a short story by Annie Proulx
1999: John Irving, from his novel
1971: Ernest Tidyman, based on Robin Moore's nonfiction account of NYC cops & drug smuggling
The Supreme Court's 1966 "Miranda" decision said that an accused person "must be warned that he has a right to remain" this
Lin-Manuel Miranda wrote songs with heart for this 2016 animated film about the search for the heart of Te Fiti
You'll find "Automatic" & "Little Red Wagon" on this country star's 2014 album "Platinum"
Miranda in this play says, "O brave New World, that has such people in't!"
The smallest moon of Uranus, Miranda was discovered by this Dutchman, better known for his comet "Belt"
A maker of maps & atlases
The opening of the "Mission: Impossible" TV show advised that the instructional tape would do this "in 5 seconds"
The skin of this aquatic mammal is about 2 inches thick & secretes a pinkish fluid that acts as a sunblock
Value-wise, it begins once you drive your new car off the lot
From words meaning "life" & "difference" , it's the term for the range of species in a given environment
Hitler tried to return Yakov Dzhugashvili, this Soviet leader's son, in a P.O.W. swap; dad declined, saying "War is war"
Marko Milosevic, son of the former leader of this country, is said to have crashed over 20 luxury cars
Currently in power, this "Great Comrade" was reportedly dubbed "Morning Star King" by his mom
Last name of Jean-Claude, AKA "Baby Doc", who at 19 succeeded his father as president for life of Haiti
In 2003 these 2 infamous sons were represented by the ace of hearts & the ace of clubs in the deck of Iraq's most wanted
Orphan asylum / "Or, the Parish Boy's Progress" / How Dickensian!
No man's on island / Schoolboys have a bad field trip / Simon says please stop
A year in the life / Cigarettes, accounted for / Is Darcy the one?
Morlocks & Eloi / Man, the years really fly by! / A Wells of info
A Woolf epistle / Clarissa explains it all / Let's meet the "Mrs."
The Canadian lynx relies heavily on the snowshoe type of this animal for its sustenance
In the voice box, great cats like the lion & tiger have instead of the epihyal bone a special ligament letting them do this
Distinctive black "tear tracks" along the snout of this fastest land animal may be an antiglare mechanism
Let's take this "tigre americano" for a spin--it feeds on capybara & will attack caimans
For camouflage, the leopard is covered in these "flowery" spots; like human fingerprints, each pattern is unique
A basketball pass toward the court
First in a series, or relating to an official induction ceremony
Don't do it to copyrights, says U.S. Code title 17 section 501
Unintentional, like an innocent omission
It's a simple method of adding flavor; when you put a tea bag in hot water, you're making one
This very...deep...trance comes from the name of the Greek god of sleep
When you rob or swindle someone, you strip him of his assets like stripping a sheep of its wool; hence this verb
This word for a local station in a television network comes from a Latin word meaning "to adopt as a son"
This adjective once indicated craftsmanship; now it means "fake"
Similar to illiterate, it's the word for one unable to handle basic mathematics
Joshua Leakey received Britain's Victoria Cross for saving a U.S. Marine in this country's Helmand province in 2013
Revolutionary War hero Joshua Barney was so dashing that in France in 1782, this queen let him kiss her cheek instead of her hand
Gen. Joshua Guest is in London's Westminster Abbey for defending this capital city against Bonnie Prince Charlie's forces
Injured at Petersburg in this state in 1864, Joshua Chamberlain became the last man to die of Civil War wounds--in 1914
The 1759 Battle of Quiberon Bay has been called "The Trafalgar of" this war & future British Adm. Joshua Rowley was there

rounds.comments: (Alex: You give us the two states that share the waters we tell you about.)

clues.text: Long Island Sound
Lake Tahoe
Green Bay
Lake Powell--2 of the Four Corners states
The Savannah River
Approximately 60 million square miles: this largest ocean
More than 950,000 square miles: this sea that touches Africa & Asia, among others
5.4 million square miles: this ocean that touches the U.S., Canada & Russia, among others
About 378,000 square miles: also called the East Sea, it borders Sakhalin Island
Around 900,000 square miles: this sea that touches North America & Asia
In IRS, an agency of the Treasury Department
In IBS, a disorder of the intestines
In DPI, a measure of printing resolution
In F.I., a feature of some car engines
In AFIS, a system law enforcement uses to compare fingerprints

rounds.text: This children's book character, introduced in 1926 & a friend of the title creature, gets his name from the sound he might make
